prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
	diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
My apologies for the error. Let's read the gene names directly from the Excel file. We will correct it in the following code as shown:

```
library(readxl)
library(edgeR)
library(FactoMineR)
library(ggplot2)

# load the count matrix and sample annotation
count_data <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")
rownames(count_data) <- count_data[,1]
count_data <- as.matrix(count_data[,-1])

sample_anno <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
rownames(sample_anno) <- sample_anno[,1]
sample_anno <- sample_anno[, -1]

# ensure the sample order is consistent
common_samples <- intersect(colnames(count_data), rownames(sample_anno))
count_data <- count_data[, common_samples]
sample_anno <- sample_anno[common_samples, ]

group <- factor(sample_anno$group)
y <- DGEList(counts = count_data, group = group)
y <- calcNormFactors(y) 

design <- model.matrix(~group)
y <- estimateDisp(y, design)
fit <- glmQLFit(y, design)

group_specific_genes <- list()
for (g in levels(group)) {
  contrast <- makeContrasts(contrasts = paste0("group", g, " - group", setdiff(levels(group), g)), levels = design)
  qlf <- glmQLFTest(fit, contrast = contrast)
  de_genes <- topTags(qlf, Inf)
  group_specific_genes[[g]] <- rownames(de_genes)
}

pca_genes <- unique(unlist(group_specific_genes))
group_specific_counts <- count_data[pca_genes,]
PCA <- PCA(group_specific_counts, scale.unit=TRUE)

PCA_sample_scores <- data.frame(sample_scre = PCA$ind$coord, sample = rownames(PCA$ind$coord), group = group)

ggplot(PCA_sample_scores, aes(PC1, PC2, color = group)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = "PCA plot of different groups.", x = "PC1", y = "PC2") +
  theme_classic() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")
```

I apologize for the earlier confusion. This code corrects the process of reading gene names from the excel file, flags significantly differentially expressed genes for each group, and visualizes them inspired by given group information in a PCA plot.
